revised_title: Determination of Collision-Induced Vibrational Transition Probabilities in Nitrogen
tldr: The authors developed a spectroscopic method to determine the probability of collision-induced vibrational transitions in nitrogen molecules. They found that the probability of a vibrational transition is of the order of 10 per gas-kinetic collision. This method can help in understanding energy exchanges during molecular collisions and aid in interpreting spectra from both laboratory and astrophysical sources.
